children.subject:
thank you very much, you encouraged me a lot! 

could you please say how I can apply for internships?

Apply to as many opportunities you can even ones you think you may not get or not even related to your career choice. Not sure what you mean by how can I apply. Just search online and start sending your resume. Make sure your resume looks good.

Not sure if this is of any help

Ya why not? You may not get an internship totally related to your intended career but something is always better than nothing. You can search thru google and find ones that have reqs that you have fulfilled. after my 1st year i got one totally not related to my major but it def taught me a lot.

definitely go for it! as a freshman and even sophomore, i always felt like i didn't have enough technical skills, and as a result i got discouraged by job rejections easily, undervalued myself, and didn't apply to enough places. don't do this!

internship applications are open for many companies so you can apply starting now. my suggestion is to find lists of companies (usually you can find compiled lists floating around on the internet), or go to linkedin/handshake and mass apply: i like to think even though the probability you'll hear back from one specific company is low, when you apply to many companies you're adding those probabilities together. don't be afraid to put yourself out there and don't be discouraged if you have a bad experience with a company
thank you for a different perspective, I highly appreciated it!

I respect your opinion but I beg to differ. The skills you learn from internships cannot be taught in a school setting, whether that is dealing with your employer, etc. Also what you learn education wise too is much different than that taught in school setting. In my summer of freshmen yr I applied for an internship at a very small company and didnt think i would get it since it was not my major. Suprisingly I ended up getting it. I didnt like it too much. It was kind of slow and I felt like I wasnt doing much. It was a summer internship and I was gonna stop it after summer anyways. They decided to extend it for a whole year looking at how much time and effort I was putting in. I said yes because I became a big part of their team. I definitely did not learn in terms of my major but I learnt a lot of professional development skills, etc. And I got a clear understanding of what I wanted from my next internship. As for joining clubs, please do but again i dont think clubs are comparable to an actual internship be it small or big. Best of luck!
Im sure you plan on working after your degree and internships can provide you practical experience and a clearer understanding of what kind of company you would prefer to work in, etc.

I'd actually disagree a bit with the other two comments, you definitely want to apply to many places if you want an internship but I'd encourage you to consider how much and internship is worth to you, and whether that's worth spending tens of hours of your time with application after application. If you're pretty quick with applications (I'm personally not, they stress the hell out of me) then yeah maybe it's not a big deal, but if they take a lot of time it might be better spent studying more for your classes, joining clubs on campus, grinding on leetcode, learning some additional skills online that you wouldn't learn in class, etc., in other words things that improve your standing for employers in the future and also just make you a smarter person in general. Plus if you mass apply and happen to end up at that one company that admits you, who says you'll enjoy the work that that company employs you for? In my opinion better to improve your marketability and then maybe you'll have more choices in the future.
you can look into the e98 decal for help getting started with resume career fairs LinkedIn and all that

history.content:
I am a freshman at the College of L&S with CS as my intended major. For the fall semester I enrolled for the Data 8 and for the spring semester I plan to enroll for CS 61A and EECS 16A. Can I apply for a summer internship with that knowledge?

If yes, how and when should I apply?

Thank you in advance
history.subject: Should I apply for internship?
